View Javadoc

1   package org.lindbergframework.persistence.sql;
2   
3   import java.sql.SQLException;
4   
5   import org.lindbergframework.exception.BeanPopulateException;
6   import org.lindbergframework.persistence.translate.SqlStringSyntaxTranslator;
7   
8   /**
9    * Class that organizes a DataSet result as a data tree (multilevel)
10   * based on SqlStringSyntaxTranslator.PROPERTY_PATTERN_SPLIT_SEPARATOR_REPLACEMENT
11   * to split the string column name in levels.
12   * <br><br>
13   * The tree nodes are {@link SqlNode} objects. To get the root node call {@link #getTree()}.
14   * 
15   * @author Victor Lindberg
16   *
17   */
18  public final class RowDataTree {
19  	
20      /**
21       * Root sql node.
22       */
23  	private SqlNode tree;
24  	
25  	/**
26  	 * String token to split the string column name in levels.
27  	 */
28  	private String stringForSplitProperties;
29  	
30  	/**
31  	 * Creates a RowDataTree with the specified dataset.
32  	 * @param dataSet dataset to create the data tree.
33  	 * @throws SQLException database access error.
34  	 */
35  	public RowDataTree(DataSet dataSet) {
36  	   this(dataSet,SqlStringSyntaxTranslator.PROPERTY_PATTERN_SPLIT_SEPARATOR);
37  	}
38  	
39  	/**
40  	 * Creates a RowDataTree with the specified dataset and stringForSplitProperties.
41  	 * @param dataSet dataset to create the data tree.
42  	 * @param stringForSplitProperties split the string column name in levels. Default value  
43  	 * @throws SQLException dataset access error.
44  	 */
45  	public RowDataTree(DataSet dataSet,String stringForSplitProperties) {
46  		init(dataSet, stringForSplitProperties);
47  	}
48  	
49  	private void init(DataSet dataSet,String stringForSplitProperties){
50  	    try{
51  	    if (dataSet.isBeforeFirst() || dataSet.isAfterLast())//must to be pointing for some position valid in dataSet
52              throw new SQLException("The DataSet can't to be pointing for before first position or after last position");
53       
54  	    this.stringForSplitProperties = stringForSplitProperties;
55       
56  	    tree = createTree(dataSet);
57  	    }catch(SQLException ex){
58  	        throw new BeanPopulateException(ex);
59  	    }
60  	}
61  	
62  	/**
63  	 * Get the root node.
64  	 * 
65  	 * @return root node.
66  	 */
67  	public SqlNode getTree(){
68  		return tree;
69  	}
70  	
71  	/**
72  	 * Builds the tree based on specified data set.
73  	 * 
74  	 * @param dataSet data set to build the tree.
75  	 * @return root node.
76  	 * @throws SQLException dataset access error.
77  	 */
78  	protected SqlNode createTree(DataSet dataSet) throws SQLException{
79  		SqlNode newRoot = new SqlNode();
80  		
81  		DataSetMetaDada meta = dataSet.getMetaData();
82  		for (int i = 1;i <= meta.getColumnCount();i++){
83  		   loadChild(newRoot, meta.getColumnLabel(i), dataSet.getValue(i));
84  		}
85  		
86  		return newRoot;
87  	}
88  	
89  	/**
90  	 * loads the node based on specified property and value.
91  	 * @param parent parent node.
92  	 * @param property current property.
93  	 * @param value node value.
94  	 */
95  	protected void loadChild(SqlNode parent, String property, Object value){
96  	    property = property.replaceAll(SqlStringSyntaxTranslator.PROPERTY_PATTERN_SPLIT_SEPARATOR_REPLACEMENT, SqlStringSyntaxTranslator.PROPERTY_PATTERN_SPLIT_SEPARATOR);
97  		loadChild(parent, 0 ,getSplitProperty(property), value);
98  	}
99  	
100 	/**
101 	 * loads the node based on current level, specified property array (multilevel) and value.
102 	 * 
103 	 * @param parent parent node.
104 	 * @param level current level.
105 	 * @param propertyAddressTokens property array (multilevel).
106 	 * @param value node value.
107 	 */
108 	private void loadChild(SqlNode parent, int level, String[] propertyAddressTokens, Object value){
109 		String property = propertyAddressTokens[level];
110 		
111 		if (level == propertyAddressTokens.length - 1){
112 			parent.addChild(new SqlNode(property,value));
113 		}else{
114 			SqlNode child = parent.getChild(property);
115 			if (child == null){
116 				child = new SqlNode(property,null);
117 				parent.addChild(child);
118 			}
119 			
120 			loadChild(child, level + 1, propertyAddressTokens, value);
121 		}
122 			
123 	}
124 	
125 	/**
126 	 * executes the split on property.
127 	 * 
128 	 * @param property property to split.
129 	 * @return split from property.
130 	 */
131 	public String[] getSplitProperty(String property){
132 	    String[] split = property.split(SqlStringSyntaxTranslator.PROPERTY_PATTERN_SPLIT_SEPARATOR);
133 		
134 		if (split.length == 0)
135 			return new String[] {property};
136 		
137 		return split;
138 	}
139 	
140 }
